page.title: 13ACTIVITIES IN SHROTON
page.content: SHROTON IS A LIVELY VILLAGE WITH PLENTY OF PASTIMES FOR RESIDENTS ORGANISED BY THE CHURCH OR THE VILLAGE AMENITIES SOCIETY. THE SCHOOL HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO A HALL, NOW A FOCUS FOR VILLAGE LIFE. SPORTS INCLUDE HUNTING. CRICKET IS PLAYED ON THE RECREATION GROUND MOST SUMMER WEEKENDS AND ON PRESIDENT'S DAY THE CLUB PLAYS AN INVITED TEAM AND IS ENTERTAINED TO A SUMPTIOUS LUNCH. AT THE VILLAGE HALL A YOUTH CLUB MEETS. EVERY YEAR THERE IS A HARVEST SUPPER, A GUY FAWKES NIGHT PARTY AND A CHRISTMAS DINNER. THERE IS A GARDENING CLUB, ART CLUB, THE WOMENS INSTITUTE AND THE OVER SIXTIES CLUB WHICH MEETS EVERY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. THERE IS A FLOWER SHOW AND A CHURCH FETE FROM WHICH RUNNERS SET OFF TO RACE OVER HAMBLEDON HILL. ALL ORGANISATIONS HAVE PARTIES, DANCES, JUMBLE SALES AND COFFEE MORNINGS.
